I really thought there was a COTS chain clamping block that clamped multiple links, something like this:

1035Ã—750 137 KB

But, I canâ€™t find such a thing at any of the usual FRC suppliers. Is such a thing available? Am I dreaming?

Screen Shot 2022-01-04 at 9.09.38 PM732Ã—364 96.7 KB

Vex has a similar chain mount plate to the Greyt one above:

vexrobotics.com

VersaFrame Linear Motion

The VersaFrame is a construction system that allows teams to build an upper frame in whatever configuration they can imagine. Pre-drilled holes on a standard 1

Price: USD 3.99

Andy Mark has a different sort of chain mount:

andymark.com

Chain Attachment Link

These connecting chain attachment links, also known as K-links, are perfect for securing components that need movement, to a chain. These versions were specifically designed by AndyMark to interface with common FRC and FTC products. The #35 chain...

You can also use half a chain tensioner and mount it to a hole on your slide with a nut or two. There are others, but hereâ€™s one:

andymark.com

#35 Inline Chain Tensioner

This Inline Chain Tensioner for #35 series roller chain is perfect to adjust the desired tension in a long run of chain on mechanisms such as elevators and arms. This is ideal where there is at least a ~3" section of chain that never passes over a...
